<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/f877983c4f5dc185bb3b4a0e8611b711/tumblr_inline_nh7n9jBoJ01rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><a href="http://bit.ly/1tmOhh5"><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/ddd31c2a72ddc59d28ba76595f802992/tumblr_inline_nh7nbi2Bx71rr2wit.png"/></a></p>

<p>Small, but useful is the best way to describe.<strong>nightingale</strong>'s.<a href="http://bit.ly/1tmOhh5"><strong>IN-FLIGHT WAYPOINTS</strong></a>. This plugin renders waypoints into flight mode. Want to switch between map and flight mode to find your waypoints? You can now do so with greater ease and with lease fear of crashing your craft.</p>

<p>Get more info about.<strong>In-Flight Waypoints</strong>.<a href="http://bit.ly/1tmOhh5"><strong>HERE</strong></a>.</p>
I support the stock-ing of this. Particularly during rover contracts, where I can't see the waypoint on the navball.
I am nightingale, and I approve of this post.
I rarely say this, but yes... definitely stock material.
This would be cool to add to a pilot's abilities as they leveled.

^^^

That would be a good implementation for stock. Although, it would seem more fitting to have it as an upgrade to the tracking facility.
Oh and before I forget, if you like the Pack-Rat pictured above, go to RoverDude's USI Exploration Pack and build one too!
I too second the stock-ifying of this mod.
I know this sounds stupid but how do you post on you're profile?

I support the stock-ing of this. Particularly during rover contracts, where I can't see the waypoint on the navball.

If you have a navball pointing upward it means you need to fix your rover design so that you can see your heading and level easily:

- For manned rovers, use the EAS-1 External Command Seat - another advantage to it is that it lets you take EVA reports and surface samples without disembarking

- For unmanned rovers, use the Probodobodyne QBE. Use the rotation gizmo to rotate it so that its top faces the front, and the "QBE" decal faces upward. Another option is to stick a docking port to the front, so that you can use "control from here".

Edited December 30, 2014 by Spheniscine
